Thanksgiving is always on a Thursday, so the day after is a Friday.
This day has come to be known as Black Friday.
Most stores offer great deals on Black Friday.
They open their doors in the wee hours of the morning.
They try to attract shoppers with big discounts.
Some items like TVs are much cheaper than usual.
Black Friday is a great time to get good deals.
These items are in high demand.
People stand in long lines to get such great deals.
The situation can be tense.
Fights have broken out over toys or people cutting in line.
People have shot one another over parking spots.
But most Black Friday events are safe and fun.
It was first used in Philadelphia in the 1950s.
The police called this day Black Friday because of the heavy traffic it drew.
The name "Black Friday" continued to spread across the country.
Now people all over the country take part in the event known as Black Friday.
It is even spreading to other parts of the world.
Stores have held Black Friday events in the U.K., Australia, and Brazil since 2012.
In Costa Rica Black Friday is known as "Viernes Negro."
And in Mexico, stores offer an annual weekend of discounts.
They call it "El Buen Fin," which means "the good weekend" in Spanish.
I guess the language of savings is universal.
Have you ever been to the beach?
Did you see a man with a headset pointing a long pole at the ground?
People use these devices to find metal.
Metal detectors make magnetic waves.
These waves go through the ground.
The waves change when they hit metal.
They cost a lot of money.
They used a lot of power.
And worst of all, they didn't work well.
People kept trying to make them better.
Now they are light and cheap.
That is why people bring them to the beach.
They can look for rings in the water.
They can look for phones in the sand.
Metal detectors help them find these things.
They usually just find junk though.
Metal detectors also protect people.
They help to keep guns out of some places.
They help guards look for weapons.
Guards use special wands to find metal on a person.
These devices save lives in other ways too.
During wars, people plant bombs in the ground.
When the war ends, they don't clean up their messes.
Others use metal detectors to find bombs.
They remove them and help the people.
These devices also make clothes safer.
Needles break from time to time.
That's because our clothes are scanned for metal.
They make the world a safer place.
The chess we play today is from Europe.
Chess is a two-player game.
One player uses the white pieces.
The other uses the White Chess Pieces black pieces.
Each piece moves in a special way.
One piece is called the king.
The players take turns moving their pieces.
The game ends when a player loses his or her king.
They think that it makes the mind stronger.
Good chess players use their brains.
These skills are useful in life and in chess.
You don't always have lots of time to think when playing chess.
In blitz chess, each player gets ten minutes to use for the whole game.
Your clock runs during your turn.
You hit the time clock after your move.
It also starts the other player's clock.
If you run out of time, you lose.
Games of blitz chess are fast-paced.
Chess is not just for people.
At first they did not play well.
As time went on they grew stronger.
In 1997, a computer beat the best player in the world for the first time.
It was a computer called Deep Blue.
It took up a whole room.
By 2006 a cell phone could beat the best players in the world.
Some people like action games.
Other people like driving games.
But the most popular game of all time is a puzzle game.
Tetris is a game about making lines.
Blocks fall from the top of the screen.
They fall one at a time.
The player moves the blocks.
Players try to make lines go across the screen with no gaps.
This gives players more room.
The blocks pile up during the game.
The game ends when the blocks get to the top of the screen.
A man named Alexey made Tetris in 1984.
All the pieces in Tetris have four blocks.
The word "tetra" means four.
Alexey named his game after tetra and tennis.
He made Tetris while working at a science academy in Moscow.
Alexey made his game on a screen that only showed letters.
He could not use blocks.
Still, all Alexey's friends loved his game.
It was easy to learn and fun to play.
Soon the game spread across the world.
It was on every computer.
It came with every one of Nintendo's Game Boy.
Tetris was all over the place.
Even today Tetris comes with many phones.
Dr. Richard Haier has studied Tetris players.
He found that playing Tetris boosts mental activity.
I agree with this finding.

Membership in pods is not rigid; interchange is common.

Patricia Denning stars in a sad movie about ambition and heartbreak.
When Cecilia leaves college in Texas, she has everything: a wonderful boyfriend, Carl, an interesting job and an expensive house in a pretty town.
Cecilia goes to Hollywood with him and leaves her boyfriend alone back home.
When the studio fires Perky, Cecilia decides to stay in Hollywood and tries to get other movie roles for her beautiful dog.
Cecilia decides to stay in Hollywood and wants to become an actress herself.
She sends Perky back to Texas and starts an acting course.
Carl has found another girlfriend.
Cecilia tries to win him back, and also discovers a lot about herself on her long journey.
